verses.verse: Man <S%H120><s%> that is <S%H3205>born<s%> of a <S%H802>woman<s%> is of <S%H7116>few<s%> <S%H3117>days,<s%> and <S%H7649>full<s%> of <S%H7267>trouble.<s%>
He cometh <S%H3318>forth<s%> like a <S%H6731>flower,<s%> and is cut <S%H5243>down:<s%> he <S%H1272>fleeth<s%> also as a <S%H6738>shadow,<s%> and <S%H5975>continueth<s%> <S%H3808>not.<s%>
And <S%H637><s%> dost thou <S%H6491>open<s%> thine <S%H5869>eyes<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> such a <S%H2088>one,<s%> and <S%H935>bringest<s%> me into <S%H4941>judgment<s%> <S%H5973>with<s%> thee?
Who <S%H4310><s%> can <S%H5414>bring<s%> a <S%H2889>clean<s%> thing out of an <S%H4480>unclean?<s%> <S%H2931><s%> <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H259>one.<s%>

Seeing <S%H518><s%> his <S%H3117>days<s%> are <S%H2782>determined,<s%> the <S%H4557>number<s%> of his <S%H2320>months<s%> are <S%H854>with<s%> thee, thou hast <S%H6213>appointed<s%> his <S%H2706>bounds<s%> that he <S%H3808>cannot<s%> <S%H5674>pass;<s%>
Turn <S%H8159><s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> <S%H5921><s%> him, that he may <S%H2308>rest,<s%> <S%H5704>till<s%> he shall <S%H7521>accomplish,<s%> as a <S%H7916>hireling,<s%> his <S%H3117>day.<s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> there <S%H3426>is<s%> <S%H8615>hope<s%> of a <S%H6086>tree,<s%> <S%H518>if<s%> it be cut <S%H3772>down,<s%> that it will <S%H2498>sprout<s%> <S%H5750>again,<s%> and that the <S%H3127>tender<s%> branch thereof will <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H2308>cease.<s%>
Though <S%H518><s%> the <S%H8328>root<s%> thereof wax <S%H2204>old<s%> in the <S%H776>earth,<s%> and the <S%H1503>stock<s%> thereof <S%H4191>die<s%> in the <S%H6083>ground;<s%>
Yet through the <S%H4480>scent<s%> <S%H7381><s%> of <S%H4325>water<s%> it will <S%H6524>bud,<s%> and bring <S%H6213>forth<s%> <S%H7105>boughs<s%> <S%H3644>like<s%> a <S%H5194>plant.<s%>
But <S%H1397>man<s%> <S%H4191>dieth,<s%> and wasteth <S%H2522>away:<s%> yea, <S%H120>man<s%> giveth up the <S%H1478>ghost,<s%> and <S%H346>where<s%> is he?
As the <S%H4325>waters<s%> <S%H235>fail<s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> the <S%H3220>sea,<s%> and the <S%H5104>flood<s%> <S%H2717>decayeth<s%> and drieth up: <S%H3001><s%>

So <S%H376>man<s%> lieth <S%H7901>down,<s%> and <S%H6965>riseth<s%> <S%H3808>not:<s%> <S%H5704>till<s%> the <S%H8064>heavens<s%> be no <S%H1115>more,<s%> they shall <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H6974>awake,<s%> <S%H3808>nor<s%> be <S%H5782>raised<s%> out of their <S%H4480>sleep.<s%> <S%H8142><s%>

O <S%H4310>that<s%> thou <S%H5414>wouldest<s%> <S%H6845>hide<s%> me in the <S%H7585>grave,<s%> that thou wouldest keep me <S%H5641>secret,<s%> <S%H5704>until<s%> thy <S%H639>wrath<s%> be <S%H7725>past,<s%> that thou wouldest <S%H7896>appoint<s%> me a set <S%H2706>time,<s%> and <S%H2142>remember<s%> me!

If <S%H518><s%> a <S%H1397>man<s%> <S%H4191>die,<s%> shall he <S%H2421>live<s%> again? <S%H3605>all<s%> the <S%H3117>days<s%> of my appointed <S%H6635>time<s%> will I <S%H3176>wait,<s%> <S%H5704>till<s%> my <S%H2487>change<s%> <S%H935>come.<s%>
Thou shalt <S%H7121>call,<s%> and <S%H595>I<s%> will <S%H6030>answer<s%> thee: thou wilt have a <S%H3700>desire<s%> to the <S%H4639>work<s%> of thine <S%H3027>hands.<s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> <S%H6258>now<s%> thou <S%H5608>numberest<s%> my <S%H6806>steps:<s%> dost thou <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H8104>watch<s%> <S%H5921>over<s%> my <S%H2403>sin?<s%>
My <S%H6588>transgression<s%> is sealed <S%H2856>up<s%> in a <S%H6872>bag,<s%> and thou sewest <S%H2950>up<s%> <S%H5921><s%> mine <S%H5771>iniquity.<s%>
And <S%H199>surely<s%> the <S%H2022>mountain<s%> <S%H5307>falling<s%> cometh to <S%H5034>naught,<s%> and the <S%H6697>rock<s%> is <S%H6275>removed<s%> out of his <S%H4480>place.<s%> <S%H4725><s%>

The <S%H4325>waters<s%> <S%H7833>wear<s%> the <S%H68>stones:<s%> thou washest <S%H7857>away<s%> the things which <S%H5599>grow<s%> out of the <S%H6083>dust<s%> of the <S%H776>earth;<s%> and thou <S%H6>destroyest<s%> the <S%H8615>hope<s%> of <S%H582>man.<s%>
Thou <S%H8630>prevailest<s%> <S%H5331>forever<s%> against him, and he <S%H1980>passeth:<s%> thou <S%H8138>changest<s%> his <S%H6440>countenance,<s%> and sendest him <S%H7971>away.<s%>

His <S%H1121>sons<s%> come to <S%H3513>honor,<s%> and he <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> it <S%H3808>not;<s%> and they are brought <S%H6819>low,<s%> but he <S%H995>perceiveth<s%> it <S%H3808>not<s%> of <S%H3926>them.<s%>
But <S%H389><s%> his <S%H1320>flesh<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> him shall have <S%H3510>pain,<s%> and his <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H5921>within<s%> him shall <S%H56>mourn.<s%>
